node.title: Jimmy Kimmel Not Surprised About Trump’s ‘Male Pattern Fraudness’
node.alt: “To find fraud in a business, you just have to look for the signs — particularly the signs at the top of the building that say ‘Trump’ on them,” Jimmy Kimmel said.
node.description: “The walls appear to be closing in on Trump — big, beautiful walls,” Kimmel said, as new details emerged from an investigation into the ex-president’s family business.
node.content: ["Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown of the previous night\u2019s highlights that lets you sleep \u2014 and lets us get paid to watch comedy. Here are the 50 best movies on Netflix right now.", "Late-night hosts were not surprised to hear that New York State\u2019s attorney general, Letitia James, is accusing Donald Trump\u2019s family business of repeatedly misrepresenting the value of its assets.", "\u201cOne year ago today, Donald Trump was still in the White House, throwing chicken nuggets at the TV, and one year from today, he could be in jail,\u201d Jimmy Kimmel said.", "On Wednesday\u2019s \u201cTonight Show,\u201d Christine Baranski said fans who mistake her for her sophisticated characters wouldn\u2019t believe how loud she gets when watching the Buffalo Bills.", "Twitter legend Dionne Warwick will pop by Thursday\u2019s \u201cLate Show.\u201d", "Kathy Griffin\u2019s career hasn\u2019t recovered from a 2017 Trump joke, and now she\u2019s hoping to find her way back onto the D-list."]
